summary:
Jiho is a Delft-based interdisciplinary researcher with Design and Art education background, focusing on tackling environmental, social and global issues. He recently studied MRes Design Pathway at the Royal College of Art in London, which enabled the foundation for building a design research methodology and approaching environment-related design professionally. With his expertise, he began his PhD study in Biodesign, a more focused field of his research interest, in September 2022 at TU Delft.

In general, Jiho can provide comprehensive insight into the project. He has experience independently researching by building his own methodology and is familiar with literature review and analysis. Besides, he has the ability to visually interpret diverse information based on his experience in typography and poster design activities. His ability to apply graphic software such as Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects and Rhinoceros supports his capability. He can also offer rich ideas and practical reviews regarding sustainability in the business field.

projects: [{'title': 'The next relationship between humans and the natural environment: A symbiotic design concept through seaweed for the marine ecosystem', 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'description': 'The project had been conducted as a final individual project for the Master of Research in Design Pathway programme. It was an attempt to intervene in environmental issues as an extension of social problems to review the vulnerability of ecological sustainability faced on human society today by provoking a reconsideration of the mature relationship between humans and nature with a symbiotic design concept.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Jiho', 'last_name': 'Kim', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Technische Universiteit Delft PhD Candidate'}]}, {'title': 'MRes Design Grand Challenge: Neo-Wellbeing, RCA Research Biennale 2021', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'description': 'Neo-Wellbeing is an interdisciplinary group project proposed for Grand Challenge: Design for Safety. It had been presented as a website simulating a speculative dystopian narrative to offer the audience a glimpse of a possible future where workers have accepted wearable technological implants measuring working efficiency. Neo-Wellbeing focused on the negative side effects of digital interactions that increasing the risk of developing mental health disorders. The purpose of the project was to propose an unsafe future on the current horizon to prevent any potential future misuse of technology and design for a safer future. \nThe work was posted on RCA Research Biennale after the project ended.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Jiho', 'last_name': 'Kim', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Technische Universiteit Delft PhD Candidate'}]}, {'title': 'Department of Applied Art Education 59th Graduation Exhibition: Fast-Act Surgical Mask, ARTARCH Gallery', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'description': "In the emergency room, a large number of healthcare workers are busy for 24 hours, day and night. Since they don't know when and what will happen, a place where they have to be nervous every minute. When they try to get their breath together for a while, an urgent patient comes in again. Every minute and every second of time is valuable here. However, no matter how urgent the situation may be, hygiene procedures can never be omitted. Furthermore, the mask must be meticulously bound and entered into the operating room, not with the earloop dental mask.\nFast-Act Surgical Mask replaced by a buckle form with an existing surgical mask that must be worn by straps. This mask will provide healthcare workers with a faster and more comfortable medical environment, with reducing time to tying it before surgery.", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Jiho', 'last_name': 'Kim', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Technische Universiteit Delft PhD Candidate'}]}, {'title': '‘Designing the Social Potential’ Project: My anniversary museum, Design Summer School 2019, Department of Design, Goldsmiths, University of London', 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'description': "This project was a multidisciplinary group study from different art & design backgrounds conducted under the theme of a museum to explore the social potential. As a museum concept that can change visitors' behaviours, the idea of My Anniversary Museum was presented for children for the period when their self-awareness and environmental awareness developed rapidly. It was an interaction service design that applied the concept of AR technology, targeted to allow adolescent students to organise their museums with their anniversaries, plan expected experiences, and form healthy self-esteem.", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Jiho', 'last_name': 'Kim', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Technische Universiteit Delft PhD Candidate'}]}, {'title': 'Celebrate ‘Hanul’ University Students Korean Typography Union, National Hangeul Museum', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'description': 'This project was an annual group exhibition of Hanul, Korean Typography Union with small clubs from 9 different art university that has a will for Hangeul and Hangeul typography. In celebration of the 20th anniversary of the union, we have prepared Korean typography works with each personality and fun under this theme. With this exhibition, we tried to commemorate the union, which have been focused on experiments and activities of Hangul typography to inform the public.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Jiho', 'last_name': 'Kim', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Technische Universiteit Delft PhD Candidate'}]}]
